docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate voted unanimously on Tuesday to pass the first federal bill aimed exclusively at safeguarding genetic privacy, ending six years of legislative gridlock. The White House announced that it supported the measure, which would bar companies from using genetic information to deny health coverage or employment.

headline.main: Senate Sends to House a Bill on Safeguarding Genetic Privacy

docs.abstract: Senate unanimously approves bill to safeguard genetic privacy and bar employers from using genetic information to deny health coverage (S)
